text: Thanks for reaching out! I actually switched off that project and onto another because of the difficulties - it appears to be working right now this morning with no issues.

Yeah, this has been an ongoing issue for me. Advanced Menus consistently DO work using the page selector, however CTAs and inline links made using the page selector do not update and point to the archived page. This happens with a url slug change as well.

yeah, this seems to be a fairly serious issue.  It seems that the page selector selects the page ID.  When you publish a page via content staging, a new page with a new id is created and the old one is archived.  Shockingly, a redirect isn't created for this archived url to the page url
i've had similar issues which has led me to in certain situations just using the staged pages for testing and then copy/pasting my changes to the live page
I'm reaching out to support now to see if we can get some action on this.
ps, there is a real url in there; i just dont want you all stalking me
Trying to choose my Inbound sessions and its like the website is over run. im getting 500 errors in console
dont steal my thunder, <@U38EZFVFE>
hmm let me check on that.  Are the session selections not working?
the load more is throwing random 500 errors
just to be safe, can you include the cache busting param in the URL you give to FB?
This is helpful, thanks

Hey <@U2H1Q3F8R>,

I'm sorry for the difficulties, please let me know if you do see it occur again and I'll be happy to take a look

i've been using this code and its working for me:
`{% unless content.featured_image %}`
`{{ openGraph() }}`
`{% endunless %}`

which then goes to an html/hubl page that has this macro so i can edit it globally and have it change everywhere:
`{% macro openGraph(value) %} `
`<meta property="og:image" content="URL" />`
`<meta property="og:type" content="website" />`
`<meta property="og:image:width" content="2500" />`
`<meta property="og:image:height" content="1313" />`
`<meta name="twitter:image" content="URL">`
`{% endmacro %}`
forgot to mention i also import that html page before i do the unless bit
it appears that my code is working, as i see it in the head of the doc.  just facebook debugger doesnt like it.  and adding the cache buster query doesnt help :disappointed:
will give that a shot, <@UGCPXTKMW>
i had the same issue with a couple of other tries that everything but facebook saw it correctly
i could just say dont share on facebook :slightly_smiling_face:
We have an open issue about this internally <@UD53A9UUR> - I'll keep you posted on any updates.
ah, thank you <@UBFA10FMF>
Weâ€™ve asked them to allocate more resources so hopefully that helps.  Thanks for letting us know about this

Question: Has anyone run into an issue with the Design Manager where you use an include statement and the console says "Missing Template", but the file is for sure there?
In fact, if I update the path to use another file in the same folder, the error goes away
and there are no errors on the file thats being included

Well, odd thing is when i deleted the file, created a new one with the same exact name, the issue went away. Now I just need to figure out why the css isn't re-minimizing. Assumed it was all of the warnings, but those are cleared now.
It may take a little while to minify after changes

Question: We are trying to track a FB campaign to a LP with HubSpot Meetings. The meetings works as an iframe on the LP. We need to be able to add some code to the head of the meetings iframe (which is on our domain) but it seems system generated. Curious if anybody has any interesting work arounds or ideas. Thanks!

Hi everyone! I'm trying to fix an issue with compliance at our org - basically there's an email module that people are using that isn't up to par. If I convert it to a global module and edit the source code there (with personalisations), will it display properly across the the rest of the templates?
